ptl_q_funcs Struct Reference

#include <ptl_queue.h>


Data Fields

int(* add )(struct ptl_q, void *)
 Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating capacity restrictions, returning true upon success and false if no space is currently available.
int(* add_wait )(struct ptl_q, void *, long)
 inserts the specified element at the tail of this queue, waiting if necessary up to the specified wait time for space to become available.
void(* clear )(struct ptl_q)
 Removes all of the elements from this queue.
void *(* peek )(struct ptl_q)
 Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of this queue.
void *(* get )(struct ptl_q)
 Retrieves and removes the head of this queue.
void *(* get_wait )(struct ptl_q, long)
 Retrieves and removes the head of this queue, waiting up to the specified wait time if necessary for an element to become available.

Field Documentation

int(* ptl_q_funcs::add)(struct ptl_q, void *)

Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating capacity restrictions, returning true upon success and false if no space is currently available.

int(* ptl_q_funcs::add_wait)(struct ptl_q, void *, long)

inserts the specified element at the tail of this queue, waiting if necessary up to the specified wait time for space to become available.

void(* ptl_q_funcs::clear)(struct ptl_q)

Removes all of the elements from this queue.

It will block all operations until it is finished.

void*(* ptl_q_funcs::peek)(struct ptl_q)

Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of this queue.

This function is read-only and therefore does not block.

void*(* ptl_q_funcs::get)(struct ptl_q)

Retrieves and removes the head of this queue.

It will block until an element is available. This function will block once it enters the function mutex.

void*(* ptl_q_funcs::get_wait)(struct ptl_q, long)

Retrieves and removes the head of this queue, waiting up to the specified wait time if necessary for an element to become available.

This function will block once it enters the function mutex.
